meanings.definition: Situated within the hull or the keel of a vessel.
meanings.sent1: The inboard engine of the boat is protected from external damage.
meanings.sent2: The inboard compartments are used for storing essential supplies on the ship.
meanings.sent3: The sailors joked that the inboard rooms were like cozy cabins in a floating hotel.
meanings.sent4: The inboard location of the treasure chest made it difficult to access.
meanings.sent5: The inboard area of the submarine felt secure and hidden from view.

meanings.definition: Toward the centerline of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot adjusted the controls to move inboard during the landing.
meanings.sent2: Passengers were instructed to stow their luggage inboard for takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The flight attendant gestured for the passengers to move inboard to balance the plane.
meanings.sent4: The storm forced the aircraft to veer inboard to avoid turbulence.
meanings.sent5: The view from the window seat showed the wingtip moving inboard during the turn.

meanings.definition: Located on or toward the inside of a vehicle or machine.
meanings.sent1: The inboard controls of the car were easy to reach for the driver.
meanings.sent2: The inboard lights illuminated the interior of the airplane during the night flight.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic inspected the inboard components of the engine for any issues.
meanings.sent4: The inboard seating provided a comfortable ride for the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The inboard camera captured the view from inside the cockpit.
